intro: Argostemma gracile, commonly known as slender argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the summer months. Argostemma gracile is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
